recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for a Pool and/or Spa(Hot Tub) permit for the installation of a new pool or spa.  If additional deck or patio work is to be included in this project a separate permit is required under either deck or patio permit. Please note all permits as part of this project will be held until all reviews are completed.

recordTypes.name: Residential Construction Permit (One and Two Family New Construction or Addition)
recordTypes.description: New Construction or addition for one- or two-family homes.

recordTypes.name: Residential Interior Remodel
recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for a Residential Interior Remodel Permit.

recordTypes.name: Pavement Sealant Professional License Application
recordTypes.description: Application for Pavement Sealant Professional License for the Village of Deerfield.  Any professional person or company applying pavement sealants within the Village of Deerfield must be licensed, including agreement to not use any coal tar products.  Reference Village Ordinance O-18-07.

recordTypes.name: Re-Roof Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for a roofing permit.

recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for a Special Event / Temporary Use Permit.

recordTypes.name: Sport Court Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for a permit for a sport court ONLY.

recordTypes.name: Telecommunications/Public Utility Permit
recordTypes.description:
Use this form to apply for a public utility installation permit, i.e. fiber optics or utility lines, Comcast, North Shore Gas, AT&T, Verizon, ComEd, etc.  
The term "public utility" includes private companies serving the public, but not municipal utilities that are, in a sense, owned by the public
This does NOT include physical small-cell cellular installations.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this form to apply for a temporary sign permit.

recordTypes.name: ZBA Variance Application
recordTypes.description: Variance Application/Administrative Appeal

recordTypes.name: Building Permit Application: Commerical
recordTypes.description:
Commercial applications include residential cluster development over two homes, three-family homes or above, townhouses, and condos. 

All work associated with commercial use, including roofing, windows, siding, and pools must use this application.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit Application: One or Two Family
recordTypes.description:
This application is used for, New Construction, Additions, Alterations, Repairs, and Demolition of One or Two-family homes only. 

Commercial applications are used for residential cluster development over two homes, three-family homes or above, townhouses, and condos.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit Application: Residential Roofing - Windows - Siding
Building Permit Application: One or Two Family: Pool
Building Department: Business Certificate Qualification Form
recordTypes.description: This request is for businesses / companies leasing or renting commercial space.

recordTypes.name: Home Occupation Application
recordTypes.description: Home occupation: An owner occupied business use conducted within a dwelling that is incidental and secondary to the primary residential use, carried on by the inhabitants of the dwelling, and does not alter the residential character of the property.

recordTypes.name: FALA Annual Certificate
recordTypes.description: Family accessory living areas are required to be inspected yearly. Failure to comply with zoning requirements could result in the removal of the unit.

recordTypes.name: Across Sidewalk Electric Vehicle Charging (EV) Permit
recordTypes.description: Residents of residential properties in a “Designated Zone” who do not have available off-street parking will be deemed “Eligible Residents” and may apply for an annual Permit. A Permit may be granted to Eligible Residents for Level 1 (110-120V) charging only in a Sidewalk Area that is contiguous with the Eligible Resident’s residential property. A Permit will not be granted for Level 2 (240V) charging in any portions of public ways.

recordTypes.name: Flood Resilience Compliance Confirmation
recordTypes.description: Flood Resilience Compliance Confirmation from the DPW is required to confirm a developments conformance with the Flood Resilience Standards outline in Cambridge Zoning Ordinance Section 22.80.   Confirmation should be received prior to application for permits with ISD and Planning, as noted in the Zoning.

recordTypes.name: How to Save and Resume a Draft of a Record in the Storefront
Pay using your bank account - Payment method
General Online Permitting and Licensing Help
Helen K. Holland Animal Care Trust Fund
recordTypes.description: Make a donation to the Helen K. Holland Animal Care Trust Fund.

recordTypes.name: Dog License
recordTypes.description: State law requires that all dogs over 6 months have a current dog license. The dog license period in Cambridge runs from April 1 of the current year to March 31 of following year.

recordTypes.name: HomeBridge Application
recordTypes.description: The City of Cambridge Community Development Department’s Housing Division administers HomeBridge, a program that provides funding for income-eligible first-time homebuyers to purchase a home on the open market. Within price limits set by the Housing Division, eligible buyers can receive up to 65% of the purchase price for a three-bedroom unit, 60% for a two-bedroom, and 50% for a one bedroom unit from the City. For more information please see our website at www.cambridgema.gov/HomeBridge.

recordTypes.name: Fire Pump Test
recordTypes.description: This application is used to collect the $350 per fire pump test location. After payment is processed, open the document to review instructions to schedule the test with the Water Department.

recordTypes.name: Street Performers Permit
recordTypes.description:
Performers interested in obtaining a free permit to perform in public in the City of Cambridge should submit this application.

The permit is free. Individual performers as well as those playing in groups must obtain permits.

No auditions required. All are welcome and encouraged to apply. A performer does not have to be a Cambridge resident in order to obtain a performance permit. We look forward to serving you and having your creativity enliven public spaces of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Pre-Fabrication Review
recordTypes.description:
The form is designed to obtain as much information as possible about your artwork in order to best care for it.  Please take the time to fill out each section with as much detail as possible.

You may not be able to fill out the whole form in one sitting; simply scroll down to the bottom of the form and click "Save Draft and Exit" to work on it later.  To access the form again, click "My Account" on the top right of OpenGov and click your "Pre-Fabrication Review" in the application section.

recordTypes.name: Cambridge Resident Bike Lottery Program
recordTypes.description: Through this program, low and moderate-income Cambridge, Massachusetts residents can apply for a voucher (certificate) to get a new bicycle. They need to choose the type of bicycle: a pedal bike an e-bike, or an e-cargo bike. People with disabilities can apply for an adaptive bike.

recordTypes.name: Emergency Contact Information
recordTypes.description: The following form is used by the Cambridge Emergency Communications Department in the event of an emergency during and after businesses hours for use by Fire, Police, and/or EMS personnel. This information will be kept confidential. Completion of this form does not constitute completion of the business certificate process.

recordTypes.name: Annual Exempt Organization Forms (3ABC)
recordTypes.description: Annual Exempt Organization Forms (State Tax Form 3ABC) should be filed annually by charitable, benevolent, educational, literary, religious, scientific, or temperance organizations and trusts owning real or personal property on January 1, for which they claim exemption for the fiscal year that begins the next July 1. Veteran organizations seeking exemption of real or personal property under M.G.L. c. 59, § 5 Clauses 5, 5A, 5B or 5C must also file this return. The State Tax Form 3ABC must be filed on or before March 1 with the Board of Assessors of each city or town in which the organization owns real estate or personal property.

recordTypes.name: Bi-Directional Amplifier Permit
recordTypes.description: Bi-directional amplifiers (BDAs) are crucial systems that boost in-building radio RF signals that are used for emergency communication. Buildings shall have radio coverage for first responders within the building at least equal to the signal strength of the City of Cambridge Public Safety radio system at the exterior, without requiring modification to the City’s existing radio system.

recordTypes.name: Block Party Permit
recordTypes.description: A block party is a community event hosted on a City street by a group of neighbors, a non-profit organization, or an association. During a block party, the City closes a block or a portion of a single street to through traffic.

recordTypes.name: Application to Modify Building Plans, Including Change of Contractor, etc.
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when modifying the scope of work or personnel (contractor, architect, etc.) for an existing Building Permit application with the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Asbestos Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when applying for an Asbestos Removal Permit in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Acoustical Music with No Amplification Except One Microphone Application
recordTypes.description: Acoustical Music with no Amplification Except One Microphone is for businesses who do not have a place to congregate for sole purposes of entertainment and are not usually licensed as a common victualler, alcohol establishment, innholder or lodging house license or any other type of license under M.G.L. c.138 or 140.

recordTypes.name: Dumpster Permit
recordTypes.description: A Dumpster Permit allows you to reserve curb space for the purpose of temporarily placing a dumpster on a City street for moving debris or garbage from a construction site. Dumpster permits are issued for a maximum of two spaces.

recordTypes.name: Carbon Monoxide Technical Option Permit
recordTypes.description: The Board of Fire Prevention Regulations states that technical compliance options may be more practical for larger residential and institutional buildings that contain minimal or no sources of CO inside the individual units. The option allows owners to target the CO alarm protection in only those areas (i.e., rooms that contain boilers, hot water heaters, central laundry areas, in addition to enclosed parking areas) that could be potential sources of the CO. This CO protection option requires hard-wiring or low-voltage wiring, monitoring (i.e., by an alarm company) and certain signal transmission requirements.

recordTypes.name: Personal Exemption
recordTypes.description:
Homeowners may reduce their tax bill by qualifying for a personal exemption for taxpayers who are: Elderly, Blind, Surviving Spouses or minor children of Deceased Parents or Veterans.  Each exemption has eligibility requirements such as age and income limits.  While you may not receive more than one personal exemption, you will receive the exemption that most reduces your tax bill should you qualify for more than one personal exemption.
If you were granted an exemption last year, we will send you a reminder for the renewal, but it is still your responsibility to make sure that you file a renewal each year.

recordTypes.name: Lab Tests for Distribution Work
recordTypes.description: This involves Cambridge Water Department conducting bacteriological testing for permitted water work in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Cryogenic & Compressed Gas Permit
recordTypes.description: A Cryogenic & Compressed Gas Permit is required for individuals or companies storing non-flammable compressed gas and/or cryogenic fluid on-site.

recordTypes.name: Residential Exemption
recordTypes.description: The application for the Residential Exemption must be filed no later than April 1st of the fiscal year. If you recently purchased a Cambridge property and inherited a Residential Exemption from the previous owner, you must qualify as the new owner to continue to receive the exemption in the next fiscal year. Please complete the Residential Exemption form to apply.

recordTypes.name: Auctioneer Permit (Annual)
recordTypes.description: The Annual Auctioneer Permit is for those who intend to conduct auctions in the City of Cambridge. A condition precedent to obtaining this Permit, is to have an Auctioneers License from the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, please refer to Consumer Affairs and Business Regulation.

recordTypes.name: Board of Appeal (BZA) Special Permit/Variance
recordTypes.description: Application to submit for special permits, appeals and petitions for variances from the terms of the Cambridge Zoning Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Addition / Alteration
recordTypes.description: Construction that changes the structure, the footprint, or the volume of the building. Including decks, porches, and additions. Any reconstruction, renovation or repair to an existing structure.

recordTypes.name: Annual Common Victualler, Alcohol and/or Entertainment License
recordTypes.description: New Applicants Only: Apply for any or all of the above listed licenses.  If you are seeking an innholder with alcohol, please apply through the innholder link.    Do not click Select if you are trying to renew your license.

recordTypes.name: Cutting & Welding/Hot Work Permit
recordTypes.description: Conducting cutting and welding/hot work in Cambridge requires that this permit is issued for your work by the Cambridge Fire Department.

recordTypes.name: Sales Verification Form
recordTypes.description:
In order to help us fully analyze the market and more fairly determine fair market value for all of the properties in the city we request that you fill out the form and schedule an inspection of your property.  

Our sales analysis process requires that we inspect your property to verify the accuracy of our data.  These inspections are made by appointment at your convenience and take only a few minutes to complete.

recordTypes.name: Food Truck Program
recordTypes.description: The City of Cambridge Food Truck Program is a business incubator initiative, designed to grow food truck and trailer businesses with an emphasis on first-time operators as well as historically excluded operators who may have limited vending options in Cambridge or the surrounding area.

recordTypes.name: Funeral/Wake Parking Permit
recordTypes.description: A Funeral/Wake Parking Permit is for funeral homes to reserve parking spaces to provide on-street parking for wake and funeral service attendees.

recordTypes.name: Change Mailing Address Request Form
recordTypes.description:
This change of address form will change the mailing address used for the real estate parcel for the Assessor’s office database and the real estate tax bill. 
Address changes will not appear on the City’s Property Database until the First half bill is mailed in the fall.

recordTypes.name: Fire Alarm System Modification Permit
recordTypes.description: NOTE: This is NOT for BRAND NEW Fire alarm systems. New fire alarm system permits are handled by the Inspectional Services Department.

recordTypes.name: Change to an Existing License Application
recordTypes.description: Apply for a Change to an Existing License.  Please complete this form when requesting any type of change to any existing license issued by this Commission.  Example of changes: hours of operation, D/B/A, capacity, or adding or removing entertainment. If the change requested is on an annual license with alcoholic beverages, please note that depending of the type of change you may also have to fill out an Alcoholic Beverages Control Commission form. Any questions, contact us at License@cambridgema.gov or 617-349-6140.  Fees: Some changes require a Hearing Fee ($100), Advertisement Fee ($75), and/or Administrative Fee ($10.00/per person CORI check). All changed that require ABCC approval have an additional $25 processing fee.  Additional fees may apply if the request is granted and the change generates a fee. Any questions, please review our fee schedules on our website or contact us at License@cambridgema.gov or 617-349-6140.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - New Construction
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when applying for a permit to build an entirely new structure in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Flammable & Combustible Material Permit
recordTypes.description: A Flammable & Combustible Material Permit is required for individuals or companies storing flammable and combustible material on-site.

recordTypes.name: Cannabis Business Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to submit a Cannabis Business Permit in the City of Cambridge

recordTypes.name: Moving Container or Crate Permit
recordTypes.description: A Moving Container/Crate Permit allows you to reserve curb space for the purpose of placing a crate or container on a City street while moving goods in or out of a building. These permits are issued for three consecutive days.

recordTypes.name: Fuel Oil Burner & Storage Permit
recordTypes.description: Installing or modifying Fuel Oil Burner or Storage equipment in Cambridge requires a Fuel Oil Burner & Storage permit issued by the Cambridge Fire Department.

recordTypes.name: Dispatch Service Application
recordTypes.description: Apply here to obtain a dispatch service license.  This includes radio, wire, cable and mobile application dispatch services.  These licenses must be renewed every year on May 1.

recordTypes.name: Disposal/Solid Waste Hauler License
recordTypes.description: Apply for a Disposal/Solid Waste Hauler License in the City of Cambridge. You need to apply for a license if you plan to be located in or provide services within the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Catering Registration
recordTypes.description: Application to submit to apply for a One-Day Catering Permit or an Annual Catering License in the City of Cambridge

recordTypes.name: Appliance/Large Items
recordTypes.description: An Appliance/Large Item disposal permit is required for the pickup of most appliances and large items.

recordTypes.name: Hazardous Material Processing Permit
recordTypes.description: A Hazardous Material Processing Permit is required for companies processing hazardous material.

recordTypes.name: Moving Van
recordTypes.description: A Moving Van Permit allows you to reserve curb space for the purpose of parking a vehicle on a City street while moving goods in or out of a building. Moving Van Permits can be issued for a maximum of two consecutive days.

recordTypes.name: Non-Resident Parking Permit
recordTypes.description: Non-Resident Parking Permits are available in limited circumstances to people who provide services to residents and property owners.

recordTypes.name: Non-water Based Fire Protection System Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for the new installation of, or modification of, non-water based fire protection systems. This permit is necessary whenever a non-water based fire protection system will be installed or impaired for modification.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Occupancy
recordTypes.description: Application to submit to request a Certificate of Use & Occupancy.

recordTypes.name: Fortune Teller License
recordTypes.description: Fortune Teller Licenses are issued to an individual for a particular location and only allow that individual to operate under the License for that particular location. If the person is telling fortunes at multiple locations within the City of Cambridge, that person must obtain a License for each location. If other persons are telling fortunes at the same location, those persons must obtain their own License.

recordTypes.name: Banner Permit
recordTypes.description: A banner permit from the Department of Public Works is required for organizations that wish to hang banners from City light poles or across the street on JFK Street at Mount Auburn Street and/or Massachusetts Avenue in front of City Hall.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration
recordTypes.description: Registering your company is required in order to submit Department of Public Works construction permits.

recordTypes.name: Garage and/or Flammables License
recordTypes.description: Apply for a Garage and/or Flammable License in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Sale and Transfer Smoke/CO Certificate (26F-26F 1/2)
recordTypes.description: This application is for an inspection to acquire a Smoke/CO Certificate for the sale and transfer of a property.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Inspection
recordTypes.description: Application to submit to request a Certificate of Inspection

recordTypes.name: Cottage Food Operation Permit
recordTypes.description: A Retail Residential Kitchen permitted to produce Cottage Food Products, as regulated by 105 CMR 590.001(C).

recordTypes.name: Other Street Occupancy Parking Permit
recordTypes.description: The Other Street Occupancy Parking Permit type allows companies/organizations to reserve curb space for the purpose of parking their service vehicle on a City street.

recordTypes.name: State Mandated Fire Inspection Registration
recordTypes.description: The State Mandated Fire Inspection program is conducted by fire suppression personnel for public and private schools, hospitals, hotels, clinics, day care centers, theaters, nursing homes, adult education centers, elderly housing, and group homes.

recordTypes.name: Hackney Driver Application
recordTypes.description: To drive a hackney carriage vehicle (taxi cab) in Cambridge you must hold a valid hackney driver license issued by the Cambridge License Commission.  At a minimum, you must be 18 years old, have a valid Massachusetts Driver’s License, submit to checks for Criminal Offender Record Information and Driving History, and be able to read, write and speak English (or understand spoken English sufficiently to discharge the duties of a hackney driver).

recordTypes.name: Hawker/Peddler License
recordTypes.description: Apply for a Hawker Peddler license here. Typical hawker/peddlers include food trucks, concession stands, or merchandising tables. You must have a state transient vendor license or if a mobile truck, a hawkers/peddler’s state license prior to applying for the city license.

recordTypes.name: Tank Installation Permit UST/AST
recordTypes.description: Cambridge Fire Department permits the installation of tanks and the piping system with this permit. You will be required to provide us detailed information about the tank, and the system of piping (leak protection, and pipe containment) associated with tank installation.

recordTypes.name: Parking Consideration
recordTypes.description: Parking Consideration is a way for residents to request that multiple vehicles be allowed to park at a residents house without being ticketed for a single day event. Parking consideration is provided only in Resident Permit Parking areas, where spaces are signed “Parking by Permit Only”. All other restrictions, including payment at meters, will continue to be enforced.

recordTypes.name: 2025-2026 DHSP Afterschool Programs Lottery
recordTypes.description:
The Department of Human Service Programs (DHSP) offers four afterschool program models. Childcare Afterschool, Community Schools, and King Open Extended Day (KOED) afterschool programs are open to Cambridge residents in Kindergarten – 5th grade.  Cambridge Youth Programs (CYP), based at Youth Centers, are open to pre-teens and middle schoolers in 4th – 8th grade. All DHSP afterschool programs are designed to foster social and emotional growth and build healthy relationships. 

Cambridge families apply to all DHSP afterschool programs through a single application, the DHSP Afterschool Programs Lottery Application. Open seats in DHSP afterschool programs are filled through a lottery system.

Re-Enrollments 
Children who are currently enrolled in a DHSP afterschool program have the option to re-enroll in the same program for the next academic year.  To re-enroll, complete and submit an application for your child, selecting their current afterschool program. Re-enrollment applications must be submitted by the application deadline.

recordTypes.name: Tank Removal Permit
recordTypes.description: Cambridge Fire Department permits the removal of storage tanks with this permit. You will be required to provide us detailed information about the tank, the containment assessment information, whether the tank(s) will be removed or secured in place, and the tank removal company information associated with tank(s) removal.

recordTypes.name: Parking Permit
recordTypes.description: Parking Permits allow you to park in areas designated “Parking by Permit Only.” Do not use this application if you are looking to apply for or renew a Resident or Visitor Parking Permit. If you have questions about the types of permits that we offer, please refer to our Parking Permit page: cambridgema.gov/parking-permits

recordTypes.name: Innholder - Lodging House
recordTypes.description: New Applicants Only: Apply for a Innholder/Lodging House License (includes dormitories, motels or hotels; excludes bed and breakfast and short term rentals, i.e. Airbnb), with or without alcohol.  Do no click Select if you are trying to renew your license.

recordTypes.name: Curb Cut
recordTypes.description: Application submit to install, remove, or modify a curb cut to allow for vehicular access from the public right of way onto private property in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Crane, Boom, Pump Truck (CBP) Permit
recordTypes.description: A Crane, Boom and Pump Truck permit is required if you are using a crane, boom truck, boom lift, man lift, lull, scissor lift, pump truck, or similar aerial/mobile vehicle on a City of Cambridge right-of way.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when demolishing 25% or more of a building in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Dewatering Permit
recordTypes.description: A dewatering permit is required for projects or businesses that plan to discharge to the municipal stormwater or wastewater system from dewatering or pumping activities or want to make changes in discharges from existing connections.

recordTypes.name: Jitney
recordTypes.description: You need to apply for a Jitney if you plan to be located in, provide services in, or have a fixed route within the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Medallion Holder Application
recordTypes.description: Apply here to obtain a new medallion, renew a medallion or transfer a medallion.  Medallion Owners must renew the medallion each March and be inspected twice a year in April and October.  Medallion Owners must hold a valid hackney driver license issued by the License Commission.  [insert link of driver license application]

recordTypes.name: Excavation Permit
recordTypes.description: An Excavation and Trench Permit is required if you are excavating or trenching on private property or in a public right-of-way in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Dumpster License
recordTypes.description: This application is for a stand alone temporary or permanent dumpster permit only.

recordTypes.name: Special Events Committee Application
recordTypes.description: A Special Event is a large event such as a festival, road race, parade, film shoot or walkathon. Such events may feature entertainment, amusement rides and food and beverages. Special events may require a number of permits from various City departments depending on the size and nature of the event. The City's Traffic, Parking, + Transportation Department manages the City's Special Event program.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Fuel Storage Permit
recordTypes.description: A Temporary Fuel Storage Permit is required for the storage of temporary fuels in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Tool Truck
recordTypes.description: A Tool Truck Permit reserves space for a specified length of time to park contractor’s vehicles while doing construction in Cambridge.  Permits can only be posted in front of your work area and cannot be posted in front of neighboring residences, in spaces reserved for persons with disabilities, across driveways, within ten feet of a fire hydrant or locations posted no parking or no stopping.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Heat Permit
recordTypes.description: Temporary Heat Permits are required for the operation of temporary heating devices.

recordTypes.name: Newsrack Permit
recordTypes.description: No person shall place, affix, erect, constitute or maintain a news rack in or on any part of a public way without first obtaining a Certificate of Compliance from the Department of Public Works.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Maintenance Agreement
recordTypes.description: Application to submit to request an Electrical Maintenance Agreement for a large institution.

recordTypes.name: Open Air Parking License
recordTypes.description: Apply for an Open Air Parking License in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Raffle and/or Bazaar Application
recordTypes.description: Apply here for a Raffle and/or Bazaar License. You need to apply for a license if you plan to host a raffle drawing or bazaar within the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when applying for a permit to perform electrical work in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Park Permit
recordTypes.description: A park permit is required for any non-athletic events in City parks or public areas and must be obtained through The Department Public Works. If you are looking to reserve an athletic field or use of Danehy Park please call the Recreation Department at (617) 349-6238.

recordTypes.name: Unvented Propane or Natural Gas Fired Space Heater Permit
recordTypes.description: An Unvented Propane or Natural Gas Fired Space Heater Permit shall be obtained from the City of Cambridge Fire Department for the installation of all unvented propane or natural gas-fired space heaters.

recordTypes.name: Traffic Clearance Permit
recordTypes.description: A Traffic Clearance Permit temporarily restricts parking for a specified length of time to provide the proper space needed for the turning radius of construction vehicles accessing a job site.  This permit is also issued to provide space for re-routing traffic from a travel lane and into a parking lane associated with large construction jobs.

recordTypes.name: Water Based Fire Protection System Modification Permit
recordTypes.description: NOTE: This is NOT for BRAND NEW water based fire protection systems. This permit is for modification of existing water based fire protection systems. This permit is necessary whenever an existing water based fire protection system will be impaired in order to perform work.

recordTypes.name: Sewer Use Abatement Application
recordTypes.description: In accordance with the City Ordinance section 13.16.080C. An applicant may apply for an abatement of sewer charge if water supplied, derived or received is used in manner that does not enter the wastewater system of the city.

recordTypes.name: Leaf Blower Permit
recordTypes.description: New Applicants Only: Apply for an annual Leaf Blower permit here. All commercial leaf blower operators (anyone who employs two or more people to operate leaf blowers) wishing to operate leaf blowers in the City of Cambridge must obtain a permit prior to operating in Cambridge. Leaf blowers can only be used March 15 – June 15 and September 15 – December 31, and on certain days and times of the week.  Do not click Select if you are trying to renew your license.

recordTypes.name: Letting of Motor Vehicles License
recordTypes.description: You need to apply for a license if you plan to operate a retail rental car business within the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Sidewalk and Street Business Use Permit (Annual)
recordTypes.description: A business use sidewalk and street obstruction permit is required if you are a business in the City of Cambridge and want to use an “A” framed sign, sandwich board, display merchandise, temporary banner or use tables and chairs on a sidewalk or street in the public way.

recordTypes.name: Farmers Market
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when applying for a Farmers Market Permit in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Traffic Special Event Permit
recordTypes.description: The Traffic Special Event Permit is reserved for the following events: Parking for a Festival, Parade, Processional, Public Safety Events, Road Race, University Events including Move-in/move-out, Walkathons, and other large events. Special events may require a number of permits from various City departments depending on the size and nature of the event. The Traffic Special Event permit only covers the use of the street. Cambridge residents, non-profit organizations, and businesses may apply.

recordTypes.name: Gas Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when applying for a Gas Permit in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Sidewalk Obstruction Permit (Construction)
recordTypes.description: A Sidewalk Obstruction permit is required if you are blocking any portion of a City of Cambridge sidewalk whether it be through full closure, partial closure, or walkthrough-staging.

recordTypes.name: Livery Application
recordTypes.description: Apply for a Livery or Limousine License in the City of Cambridge. You need to apply for a license if you plan to operate and/or garage your Livery or Limousine business(s) within the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: One Day Alcoholic and/or Entertainment License
recordTypes.description: Apply for special one-day alcohol and/or a one-day entertainment license here.  One-day licenses are required for events that are advertised and/or open to the public.  Please note that a person can only obtain a total of 30 one-day licenses per location in one calendar year.  You may use this application to apply for a license during consecutive days in the same location.

recordTypes.name: Special Events Committee Application
recordTypes.description: A Special Event is a large event such as a festival, road race, parade, film shoot or walkathon. Such events may feature entertainment, amusement rides and food and beverages.  Special events may require a number of permits from various City departments depending on the size and nature of the event. The City's Public Works Department manages the City's Special Event program.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment
recordTypes.description: Application to submit to apply for a Food Establishment Permit in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Stormwater Control Permit
recordTypes.description: A stormwater control permit is required for construction, development and redevelopment projects in the City of Cambridge to ensure that measures are taken throughout the project to address erosion, nonpoint source pollution, and flood control.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when applying for a mechanical permit in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: One Day Amendment to an Existing License
recordTypes.description: Please complete this form when requesting a one day change to an existing license issued by this Commission, i.e. changes in hours of operation, capacity or entertainment. Please note that if you have an annual alcohol license and are seeking to extend to an area that is not presently covered by your alcohol license, you cannot complete this form.  You must complete a One Day Alcohol License Application.  Any questions, contact us: License@cambridgema.gov.

recordTypes.name: One Day Temporary Amusement Application
recordTypes.description: Apply for a One Day Temporary Amusement permit here. One Day Temporary Amusement permits are required if the event is open to the public or there is a fee to participate.

recordTypes.name: Short Term / Special Event Sidewalk Business Use Permit
recordTypes.description: A temporary business use sidewalk obstruction permit is required if you are a plan to temporally obstruct a City of Cambridge sidewalk. Please apply for an Annual Sidewalk Obstruction Permit if you plan to use an “A” framed sign, sandwich board, display merchandise, temporary banner or use tables and chairs on a sidewalk in the public way.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Truck
recordTypes.description: Application to submit to apply for a Mobile Food Truck Permit in the City of Cambridge

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when applying for a Plumbing Permit in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Construction Access
recordTypes.description: A Temporary Construction Access permit is required for temporary access across a public right-of-way to any construction site.

recordTypes.name: One Day Temporary Auctioneer Application
recordTypes.description: Apply for a One-Day Auctioneer Permit if conducting an auction in Cambridge.  Applicants must first be licensed as Auctioneers through the Commonwealth of Massachusetts, see Consumer Affairs and Business Regulation.

recordTypes.name: One Day Hawker/Peddler License Application
recordTypes.description: Apply for a One Day Hawker Peddler license here. One-day licenses can be issued for up to 30 consecutive days.

recordTypes.name: Tree Removal Permit
recordTypes.description: In accordance with City Ordinance Section 8.66.055, a tree removal permit must be procured from the City Arborist to remove a significant tree on private property.

recordTypes.name: Private Property Rodent Control
recordTypes.description: Application to request Rodent Control Services from the City for properties with four or fewer units.

recordTypes.name: Roof Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to replace a roof covering on a building in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Pawnbroker License
recordTypes.description: Apply for a Pawnbroker License in the City of Cambridge. You need to apply for a license if you plan to conduct a retail Pawnbroker operation within the City of Cambridge..

recordTypes.name: Pole and Conduit
recordTypes.description: The City of Cambridge’s Pole and Conduit Commission is the entity responsible for providing grants to allow utilities, companies or persons to attach to poles, install conduit aerially or underground, and install equipment within the public way pursuant to Massachusetts General Law Chapter 166, the Special Acts of 1922, Chapter 213, and Cambridge Municipal Code Chapter 15.16. The Commission is comprised of three (3) members – the Chair of the License Commission, the Superintendent of Streets, and the City Electrician.

recordTypes.name: Sheet Metal
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when applying for a permit to perform sheet metal work in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Short-Term Rentals
recordTypes.description: Short-term rental (STR) refers to the rental of any dwelling unit or bedroom as residential accommodation for a duration of less than 30 consecutive days. Short-term rentals are allowed within certain parameters, and there are rules and regulations you must follow to legally rent out your residence on a short-term basis. See section 4.60 of the Cambridge Zoning Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Small Cell Wireless Installation
recordTypes.description: This application should be completed only if seeking a grant to attach/upgrade a small cell wireless installation, inclusive of the conduit necessary to make it operational.  Please review the Pole and Conduit Commission’s Small Cell Policy and the Commission’s Siting Policy.

recordTypes.name: Second Hand Goods, Junk Dealers and/or Antiques
recordTypes.description: Apply for a Second Hand Goods, Junk Dealers and/or Antiques License in the City of Cambridge. You need to apply for a license if you plan to solicit for, be a collector of, or a dealer in antiques, secondhand goods and/or junk within the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Siding Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when applying to replace or repair siding on a building in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Sign/Awning Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to submit to install or modify a sign in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Special Licenses Application (Charity Wine or Farmer's Market)
recordTypes.description:
Use this link to apply for:
1.) Charity Wine Fundraising License (approved by Board and ABCC); or
2.) Farmer’s Market License (approved by Board only).

recordTypes.name: Special Noise Variance
recordTypes.description: (Cambridge Municipal Code Chapter 8.16.090)   This application allows you to request a variance for those activities that are regulated by the Noise Control Ordinance which include limitations on measured and non-measured noise disturbances, hours of construction, and use of certain equipment.  Special Variances may be granted if the applicant shows “that bringing the source of sound or activity for which the special variance is sought into compliance with [Chapter 8.16] would constitute an unreasonable hardship on the applicant, on the community, or on other persons.”

recordTypes.name: Solar Panel Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when applying for a permit to install a thermal or photovoltaic solar energy system in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Sprinkler/Standpipe Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when applying for a Sprinkler/Standpipe Permit in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Used Car Dealer License
recordTypes.description: New Applicants Only: Apply for a Used Car Dealer License in the City of Cambridge. Do no click Select if you are trying to renew your license.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when applying for a Swimming Pool, Wading, Hot Tub or Whirlpool Permit in the City of Cambridge.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Service
recordTypes.description: Application for a Temporary Food Service Permit to operate for no longer than 14 consecutive days in conjunction with a single event or celebration.

recordTypes.name: Tent Permit
recordTypes.description: Anyone wishing to erect a tent covering an area greater than 120 square feet or with more than ten occupants must obtain a permit per the Massachusetts State Building Code.

recordTypes.name: Tobacco License Without Food Establishment License
recordTypes.description: Application for a license to sell tobacco products without a Food Establishment License. Do not use this application if you sell tobacco products along with prepacked food.

recordTypes.name: Recreational Camp License
recordTypes.description: Application to submit when applying for a Recreation Camp License in the City of Cambridge.

categories.name: Assessing
categories.content:
The Assessing Department manages commercial/industrial and residential property values and maintains an extensive database of property information. Some of this information is available online in the Property Database.

In addition, the Assessing Department manages personal property (business) values and Motor Vehicle Excise Tax.

categories.name: City Clerk's Office
categories.content: The City Clerk is the official record keeper for the City of Cambridge. Records kept by the Office of the City Clerk include vital statistics (including birth, marriage, domestic partnerships and death) and business and professional certificates.

categories.name: Emergency Communications
categories.content: <div><span style="font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif;">The Emergency Communications Department serves as the communications and technological link between Fire, Police, Emergency Medical Services (EMS), and mental health support resources for those who live, work, study and visit the City of Cambridge. The department operates the City’s Combined Emergency Communications and 911 Center (ECC) located at the Robert W. Healy Public Safety Facility. The Center receives over 50,000 911 and

categories.name: Fire Department
categories.content:
The Bureau of Fire Prevention within the Cambridge Fire Department is responsible for providing fire and life safety protection to the public by ensuring fire code compliance and enforcement of the Fire Prevention Laws and Codes. Two major functions of the Bureau are the review of building plans for all life safety systems and the inspection and testing of any installation, alteration, modification, or repair to any fire alarm, sprinkler or suppression system.

Below you will find a list

categories.name: Frequently Asked Questions and Useful Documents
categories.content: Welcome to the City of Cambridge Online Permitting and Licensing Help section.

categories.name: Inspectional Services
categories.content:
Inspectional Services

The City of Cambridge Inspectional Services Department is updating its counter hours to serve you better and improve your overall experience. These changes aim to provide more efficient and convenient service. 

Effective Monday, February 5, 2024, please see the new Cambridge Inspectional Services New Counter Hours:

Morning Sessions:
Monday -

categories.name: License Commission
categories.content:
License Commission

The Board of License Commissioners is a three-member Board comprised of the Chairperson, Fire Chief, and Police Commissioner.  It is responsible for issuing licenses and permits, and enforcing rules, regulations, local ordinances and state laws.  Licenses and permits issued by the Board include: alcohol (annual and one-days), package stores, clubs, common victuallers, innholders, lodging houses

categories.name: Public Works
categories.content:
Public Works

The Cambridge Department of Public Works provides dependable, high quality and accessible service--maintaining, improving and expanding a safe, healthy, attractive and inviting physical environment. The department supports the infrastructure of a vibrant community through comprehensive planning, scheduled maintenan

categories.name: Traffic, Parking, and Transportation
categories.content: The Traffic, Parking, and Transportation Department (TP+T) oversees public parking and traffic operations, including pavement markings, crosswalks and bicycle lanes, operation of traffic signals, traffic study reviews, and permitting street obstructions and street closings. The department also oversees the Resident Permit Program. Additionally, TP+T works closely with other City departments in planning, reviewing, and developing proposals to improve the City’s infrastructure and encoura

categories.name: Water Department

recordTypes.name: Kennel License
recordTypes.description: This license is for Kennel owners or boarders.

recordTypes.name: Additional Trash Barrel Request
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request an additional 64-gallon trash barrel. Must be a registered (census) property owner or tenant in the City of Methuen. The cost is $100 per year.

recordTypes.name: How To Create an Applicant Log-In from the Public Portal
Solar Panel Install Permit
recordTypes.description: Solar Panel Installation permit application.  Solar design and installation must be compliant with Massachusetts Laws and recognized Codes and City Ordinances.

recordTypes.name: Incident Report (NFIRS) Request
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request a copy of a Methuen Fire Department Incident Report (NFIRS Form).

recordTypes.name: Vital Records Certified Request (Birth; Death; Marriage)
recordTypes.description: Birth records for people born in Methuen or whose parents were living in Methuen at the time of their birth. ID IS REQUIRED FOR THIS REQUEST.  APPLICATIONS SHOULD BE COMPLETED ONLINE ALONG WITH PAYMENT, AND A PHOTOGRAPH OF IDENTIFICATION TO COMPLETE THE PROCESS.

recordTypes.name: Ambulance Patient Care Report Request
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request a copy of a Methuen Fire Department Ambulance Patient Care Report.

recordTypes.name: Certified Abutters List
recordTypes.description:
This application is for obtaining a certified abutters list the the City of Methuen Assessor's Office.  Select the parcel / address for which you are requesting abutter list.

Location selected must include MBL number.

recordTypes.name: How to Save and Resume a Draft of a Record on the Public Site
Dumpster/Donation/Storage Bin Permit - ANNUAL
recordTypes.description: This application may be used for all ANNUAL dumpster, food establishment dumpsters, and storage or donation bin installations.  Once issued the permit will be good for one year and may be renewed subject to the rules / discretion of the issuing authority.

recordTypes.name: Additional Recycle Barrel Request
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request an additional FREE 95-gallon Recycle barrel.  Must be a registered (census) property owner or tenant in the City of Methuen

recordTypes.name: Smoke CO Cert (1 or 2 Family)
recordTypes.description: This is the application for a Smoke / CO Certificate of Compliance for a 1 or 2 Family Home.  Can be used in limited applications for a single unit of a Townhouse or Condo Multifamily providing that all other required elements (e.g. Fire Alarm / Sprinkler) are in compliance

recordTypes.name: Storage Shed Construction / Installation Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for the construction or installation of a Storage Shed.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Building permit for the construction, alteration, addition, demolition, or modification of any structure in the City of Methuen.  (not for fences)

recordTypes.name: Fire Alarm Annual Inspection &Testing Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for annual inspection testing and minor maintenance of NFPA 72 Fire Alarm Systems.  Permit is issued to company qualified by Massachusetts Board of State Examiners of Electricians (and covers all qualified employees) for general inspection testing and maintenance of NFPA 72 systems at all properties in the City of Methuen for the duration of the calendar year of issue.

recordTypes.name: Trash \ Recycle Barrel Exchange
recordTypes.description: Use this application to Exchange your Trash \ Recycle barrel for a smaller 35-gallon barrel.

recordTypes.name: Dumpster/Donation/Storage Bin Permit - TEMPORARY (30 Days)
recordTypes.description: This application may be used for all temporary dumpster (usually related to renovations and construction) and storage or donation bin installations.  Once issued the permit will be good for 30 days and may be renewed subject to the rules / discretion of the issuing authority.

recordTypes.name: Dog License
recordTypes.description: New and renewal licenses for dogs occur between March 1 - May 31 yearly. NB: Payment of Fees is required, but does not guarantee that a permit will be issued. The Application must pass all required approvals first.

recordTypes.name: Occupancy Permit (for rentals)
recordTypes.description:
This permit is for all residential rental units and must be obtained (for each unit) by the owner / management company prior to renting the unit.  

This Occupancy Permit requires you to be compliant with the 

MINIMUM STANDARDS OF FITNESS FOR HUMAN HABITATION (STATE SANITARY CODE, CHAPTER II) 105 CMR 410 (mass.gov) 

You should review the code and the conditions of your property prior to requesting the Methuen Board of Health inspection.  Failure to do so may result in a delay in getting an Occupancy Permit issued.

recordTypes.name: Sprinkler System Annual Inspection &Testing Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for annual inspection testing and maintenance of NFPA 13 based Sprinkler Systems (and systems covered by NFPA 25).  Permit is issued to company qualified by the State of Massachusetts (and all of its qualified employees) for general inspection testing and maintenance at all properties in the City of Methuen for the duration of the calendar year of issue.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Dwelling Unit Permit (ADU)
recordTypes.description: This Permit is for the construction of an Accessory Dwelling Unit (ADU) per 760 CMR or the conversion of an already permitted Accessory Use Apartment into an Accessory Dwelling Unit.

recordTypes.name: Amusement License (Events)
recordTypes.description: THIS APPLICATION MUST BE SUBMITTED AT LEAST 30 DAYS PRIOR TO THE PLANNED EVENT. Permit for a public event including Amusements, Concerts, Shows and Exhibitions.  The Application must pass all required approvals first. Religious Societies conducting events on property owned by them; Events given in school buildings by or for the benefit of pupils or Events on public property permitted and approved by the appropriate permit granting authority,

recordTypes.name: Fuel Oil Burning FP-056 (Form 1)
recordTypes.description: For new / replacement residential or commercial oil burner installation and related above ground oil tank removal / install.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment Permit (for Annual or Temporary food service)
recordTypes.description: Food Establishment Permits are required for all entities that serve, sell, handle, or distribute packaged and non packaged foods to the public.  Is required for both temporary and permanent locations.  This permit is good for a maximum of one year from the date of issue and subject to inspections by Methuen Board of Health inspectors.

recordTypes.name: Spa (Hot Tub) Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for a public, semi-public Spa (a.k.a Hot-tub) Permit.  Application should be made at least one month prior to the planned opening date of the Spa.

recordTypes.name: Why is applicant seeing an icon for "Plaid" when paying fee by E-check?
Staff Request for Internal Support (NOT FOR PULIC USE)
recordTypes.description: This application / record is for City of Methuen STAFF to request help from our internal OpenGov administrators  (NOT FOR PUBLIC USE)

recordTypes.name: Tanning Establishment Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for establishing a tanning salon as a stand alone business or as part of another business.

recordTypes.name: Hot Work - Welding, Cutting, and Other Hot Work Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit for activities relating to 527 CMR 1.00 Chapter 41 Welding, Cutting, and Other Hot Work (NFPA 51B, Standard for Fire Prevention During Welding, Cutting, and Other Hot Work)

recordTypes.name: Alcohol License
recordTypes.description: Application for all types of alcohol licensing (on-premise, off-premise, one-day)

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool / Hot Tub (INSTALLATION) Permit
recordTypes.description:
This application is for the installation of a swimming pool or hot tub. POOL INSTALLATION MUST COMPLY WITH 2015 International Swimming Pool and Spa Code (ISPSC)   

https://codes.iccsafe.org/content/ISPSC2015

recordTypes.name: Tent, Awning, & Canopy Permit
recordTypes.description: This form is used whenever a tent, awning or canopy is installed.

recordTypes.name: Propane Tank Installation (AG/UG)
recordTypes.description: Permit for installation of new or replacement Propane Tanks (above ground or under ground).

recordTypes.name: Beaver / Muskrat Management Application
recordTypes.description: Application for emergency permit to manage a health threat caused by beaver or muskrat.

recordTypes.name: Municipal Lien Certificate
recordTypes.description: Use this form to request a Municipal Lien Certificate online

recordTypes.name: Automatic Amusement License (Gaming Machines)
recordTypes.description: Licenses for Automatic Amusement or Entertainment machine(s) such as Pinball / Video Games / Prize Machines / etc..., which require form payment or credits to be used.   Failure to License machine may result in seizure per Methuen Municipal Ordinances.

recordTypes.name: TEST *** DO NOT USE ****   (ZONING) Zoning Appeals
recordTypes.description: This application is for Zoning Board of Appeals.  It is used in the event that you need to appeal a decision made by Zoning review in which a denial was issued.

recordTypes.name: Entertainment License (Live/Recorded/Broadcast/Amplified)
recordTypes.description: Licenses for Live or Recorded Music / Jukeboxes / TVs / Karaoke,  etc..., and performances by hired entertainers, staff, or customers.  This is an annual licensed issued to the named business at the recorded location.

recordTypes.name: Public or Semi-Public Pool Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for all swimming pools used in commercial or semi-public applications (such as condo developments).

recordTypes.name: Steel Underground Tank Removal (FP-292) with Documented Disposal
Certificate of Inspection
recordTypes.description: Certificate of Inspection, as required by various licensing authorities and Table 110 of the MA State Building Code

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when installing any electrical wiring, electrical appliances, electrical services, etc.  Also includes low voltage wiring including cable TV, internet, phones, security alarm systems, etc.

recordTypes.name: Storage of Flammable - Combustible (Liquids, Gases, and Solids)

recordTypes.description: Sheet Metal Work means the manufacturing, fabrication, assembling, handling, erection, installation, dismantling, alteration and repairing of all commercial duct or air exhaust systems, except for refrigeration and combustion units; installation of commercial fans, sheaves, belt guards, dampers, louvers, screens, registers, grilles, diffusers, sound traps, attenuators, mixing boxes and access doors in connection with duct or air exhaust systems, commercial and industrial architectural sheet metal watershed roof systems, except for roof coverings and associated metal flashing; the testing, adjusting and air-balancing of all air-handling equipment and ductwork installed during new or remodeling construction, the installation of commercial and industrial kitchen hoods, kitchen vents, bathroom exhaust vents and fans; provided, however, that sheet metal work shall not include the work conducted by a licensed pipe fitter, oil burning technician, refrigeration technician, plumber or gasfitter as determined by the laws and regulations relating to those professions. NOTE: Function and purpose shall determine "sheet metal" work, not the materials employed.  For example, PVC (Polyvinyl Chloride) and CPVC (Chlorinated Polyvinyl Chloride) duct work systems are included in 271 CMR 2.01:  Sheet Metal Work.

recordTypes.name: Comprehensive Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
Chapter 40B is a state statute that encourages the development of low- and moderate-income housing by providing a streamlined permitting process and relief from local zoning requirements. Also known as the Comprehensive Permit Law, Chapter 40B was enacted in 1969 to help address the shortage of affordable housing in Massachusetts. The law requires that at least 20%-25% of units in a development have long-term affordability restrictions. Under Chapter 40B, the local Zoning Board of Appeals (ZBA) is the permit granting authority. The ZBA must review and make decisions (approve, approve with conditions, or deny comprehensive permits) in a public hearing setting.

A prerequisite to filing with the ZBA for a comprehensive permit is the issuance of a Project Eligibility Letter from a subsidizing agency.  The Sponsor has submitted an application for project eligibility to the Massachusetts Department of Housing and Community Development (the Subsidizing agency).

(A) No person shall sell any food at retail between the hours of 1:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m.
(B) No store or place of business engaged in the retail sale of food shall be open for transaction of retail business between the hours of 1:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m.

The Licensing Board may issue a special permit allowing a store to remain open for the transaction of business to an hour, specified in the permit, later than 1:00 a.m., or to remain open 24 hours a day. Special permits shall remain in effect for a period of one year.

categories.content:
Welcome to the Watertown Conservation Commission Online Permitting!

Below, you will be able to complete appropriate applications. Supplemental information pertaining to the Watertown Conservation Commission, including (but not limited to) filing deadlines, the Watertown Wetland Ordinance, rules & regs, and guidance documents can be found at:

categories.name: License Commission
categories.content:
License Commission

The Board of License Commissioners is a three-member Board.  It is responsible for issuing licenses and permits, and enforcing rules, regulations, local ordinances and state laws.  Licenses and permits issued by the Board include: alcohol (annual and one-days), package stores, clubs, common victuallers, innholders, garage and gasoline storage permits, hackney carriages and drivers, open air park

recordTypes.description: Apply to make an amendment to an existing Order of Conditions. The Conservation Commission considers an Amendment to be necessary when a change in a permitted project is proposed that may require additional conditions to ensure adequate protection of wetland resource areas and/or the interests covered under the Wetlands Protection Act and Beverly's Wetlands Protection Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Notice of Intent (NOI)
recordTypes.description: To protect the Commonwealth's wetland resources, the Massachusetts Wetlands Protection Act prohibits the removal, dredging, filling, or altering of wetlands without a permit. To obtain a permit (called an Order of Conditions), you must submit a Notice of Intent application to the Beverly Conservation Commission and MassDEP.

recordTypes.name: Body Art Establishment Application
recordTypes.description: For both renewal and initial body art establishment permits.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Application
recordTypes.description: This is a brief application that will require you to fill out a few fields and you will then be directed to a link where you will be able to access the zoning application forms and checklist. Please submit one copy of the application to the Building Commissioner so he can  review it before you fill out the other nine copies. Do not upload zoning applications to this application.

recordTypes.name: Hazard Tree Removal Request
recordTypes.description: The Commission recognizes the potential hazards that dead, dying, and compromised trees can pose to safety and property. The Commission has established a protocol to address instances where four or fewer trees are located outside of the wetland resource area but within the buffer zone and may pose a hazard to safety and/or property. A letter from a Certified Arborist may be required to verify the condition of said trees as compromised or hazardous.

recordTypes.name: Request for Certificate of Compliance (COC)

The Commission will then issue a Certificate of Compliance after confirming that the project has been completed in substantial compliance with the original Order of Conditions.

No public hearing or legal advertisement is required for a Modification to an Order of Conditions, but the applicant must submit a written request and revised plan fully explaining the proposed change and appear before the Conservation Commission at a regularly scheduled public meeting.

recordTypes.name: OA Parking Sticker
recordTypes.description:
The Department of Older Adult Services offers a parking sticker to Newton residents, age 65 or older, free parking in the City’s municipal parking lots, with some restrictions.  The applicant must attach a copy of their valid driver's license and vehicle registration.  The program does not apply to vehicles that have a commercial registration.   For more detailed information please visit our website at www.newtonma.gov/seniorparking.

Please note that the payment processing vendor for NewGov charges a 2.99% + $.99 per credit card transaction and $2.25 flat rate per transaction for electronic checks.  If you prefer to pay in person without a fee, please visit our website at www.newtonma.gov/seniorparking for detailed instructions for Options 2 or 3. 

There are three steps in the process.  1. Review of your application; 2. Processing your payment; 3. Advising when your sticker is ready for pick up.  You will receive an email from NewGov as you are approved in each step.

If you would like to submit more than one parking sticker request for the same household, you can create one NewGov log-in (or use one you have already created) and submit two separate requests.  The driver's license and vehicle information can be different in each request.

This Special Event Permit Application is a guide for individuals, groups, organizations, and businesses who are looking to host an outdoor event on City of Newton property. 

During the application process, the applicant will receive a list of tasks to be completed for other approvals or permits required for the special event. Other fees may apply for additional permits and approvals. 



***All Road Race/5K's/Runs and Walk applications must be submitted by January 15 for events scheduled March - May, April 1 for events scheduled June - December ***



\\\Applications for 2026 Events will not be reviewed until January 2026.\\\

recordTypes.description:
New Applicants Only: Apply for any or all of the above-listed licenses. Do not click Select if you are trying to renew your license.

A Common Victualler's License is required for any establishment that has seating for the public for the consumption of food and/or drinks on premises.
An Alcohol License is required for the sale of alcohol to the public.
An Entertainment License is required for any common victualler license holder to have a radio, television,     juke box, internet radio or broadcast at their establishment.
A Coin-Operated Automatic Amusement Device(s) License is required for any establishment that         provides a coin-operated machine for use.

recordTypes.description: Apply for a Farmer's Market Permit for the sale of wines, malt beverages, and/or distilled spirits manufactured by a licensed Farmer Winery, Farmer Brewery, Pub Brewery, or Farmer Distillery at approved agricultural events in Massachusetts. This permit allows a winery, brewery, or distillery to provide samples of their produced alcoholic beverages to consumers and sell by the bottle/case their product for off-premises consumption at indoor or outdoor agricultural event. Any questions, contact us at licensing@newtonma.gov or 617-796-1420.

This permit is also to be used when the removal of trees from a single- or two-family residential occupied lot is to occur where a trunk diameter of the tree(s) is 40 inches or greater.

Typical needs include minor construction work or on-street spaces needed for a moving van. Once the application is submitted to the Transportation Division, the City of Newton Parking Manager will review and if approved, a cost will be generated and the applicant will be notified via email. Upon payment, the parking spaces can be reserved.

recordTypes.name: War Memorial Rental
recordTypes.description:
The City Hall War Memorial auditorium is a beautiful historic space. It is used regularly for meetings, performances, and events.  It has tall columns lining the center of the room, large windows, high ceilings, and a raised stage. 

The room can fit 375 people with chairs only. We provide 195 chairs; if you need additional ones you are welcome to bring them. The room's capacity is 175 if your setup includes tables. Included in your rental are 10 6' x 30" tables; if you need additional tables, you are free to bring them. There is additional seating in the balcony. You will see detailed specs once you proceed with your application. Pricing ranges from $50-$100/hr depending on the day/time of your rental; for evening and weekend rentals there is a 4-hour minimum. Additional fees apply for use of the piano and/or AV equipment.

recordTypes.name: Tree Permit Application - Exemption Tree Permit Form
recordTypes.description: This application is for a Exempt Tree Permit. Use this application for non construction related tree removal that meet the following requirements. Applies ONLY to trees being removed that are located on a single- or two-family residential occupied lot where no exterior construction is presently underway or planned to take place during the 24 months from the date of the permit application and the tree(s) is between 6 inches and 39 inches in trunk diameter. All other tree removal activity or exterior construction require a different tree permit. See https://newtonma.portal.opengov.com/categories/1089

recordTypes.name: Change to an Existing License Application (current alcohol license holders)

Example of changes: alteration of premises. change of manager, change of officers, change of ownership interest, change of hours, or adding or removing entertainment. If the change requested is on an annual license with alcoholic beverages, please note that depending on the type of change you may also have to fill out an Alcoholic Beverages Control Commission form. Any questions, contact us at licensing@newtonma.gov or 617-796-1420.

recordTypes.name: Comprehensive Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
Chapter 40B is a state statute that encourages the development of low- and moderate-income housing by providing a streamlined permitting process and relief from local zoning requirements. Also known as the Comprehensive Permit Law, Chapter 40B was enacted in 1969 to help address the shortage of affordable housing in Massachusetts. The law requires that at least 20%-25% of units in a development have long-term affordability restrictions. Under Chapter 40B, the local Zoning Board of Appeals (ZBA) is the permit granting authority. The ZBA must review and make decisions (approve, approve with conditions, or deny comprehensive permits) in a public hearing setting.

A prerequisite to filing with the ZBA for a comprehensive permit is the issuance of a Project Eligibility Letter from a subsidizing agency.  The Sponsor has submitted an application for project eligibility to the Massachusetts Department of Housing and Community Development (the Subsidizing agency). A Zoning Review Memorandum is also required prior to submittal of a Comprehensive Permit.

Example of changes: adding sidewalk seating, adding parking space , change of hours or adding entertainment. Any questions, contact us at licensing@newtonma.gov or 617-796-1420.

recordTypes.name: Comprehensive Sign Package Application
recordTypes.description:
Comprehensive Sign Plans for Properties with Multiple Establishments. 

Properties with multiple commercial or institutional establishments may, depending on the site plan, architecture, and signage layout, be more difficult for a visitor to navigate to their destination, and as such, have additional sign standards intended to make it easy to navigate to the property and then to the ultimate destination.

The Planning Department recommends any property with 5 or more commercial or institutional establishments and any property seeking approval of the signs listed in section 5.2 of the zoning ordinance apply for a comprehensive sign plan.

Please contact Shubee Sikka at ssikka@newtonma.gov prior to submitting a comprehensive sign package application.

recordTypes.name: Petition for Grant of Location
recordTypes.description:
Petitioners must apply for a grant of location to install or maintain gas or electric infrastructure. MGL 164 - Sec. 70 requires that each petition for grant of location be submitted to the City Council before it is sent to the Public Works Department for a preliminary review.   

 

The comments of the Public Works Commissioner will be part of the record submitted to the City Council.  Upon filing with the City Council, the petition will be scheduled for a public hearing before the Public Facilities Committee of City Council.  

 

The petitioner is responsible for ensuring that the petition is complete and all required materials are in order for review.

recordTypes.name: How to Save and Resume a Draft of a Record in the Storefront
Newton Community Stage Rental
recordTypes.description:
Newton Community Stage is a state-of-the-art auditorium housed at the newly renovated Lincoln-Eliot School. Included in your rental is use of the auditorium entry area; a video screen and projector in the auditorium; and music stands, chairs, and a baby grand piano on the stage. In addition we have six-foot tables available should you need them. You will see detailed specs once you proceed with your application.  

Pricing ranges from $75-$100/hr depending on the day/time of your rental for Newton residents, or $100-$125/hr for non-residents. There is a 2-hour minimum for weekday rentals and a 4-hour minimum for weekend rentals. Additional fees apply for use of the piano and/or audio/video equipment.

If you are interested in a long-term rental, please email culture@newtonma.gov with your requested day, time, and rental period.

recordTypes.name: Petition for Water, Drain and/or Sewer Extension
recordTypes.description: Extensions of main pipes shall only be made when authorized by the city council.

recordTypes.name: Pay using your bank account - Payment method
Design Review
recordTypes.description:
Please do not use this application if you are just looking to install a sign. Use the "Sign Review" application.

Design Review is one of the tools we use to create a better city. Design Review by the Urban Design Commission (UDC) is encouraged for most new multifamily and commercial buildings that require a Special Permit. UDC reviews multiple aspects of a building and its site, including some of the following:
•The overall appearance of the building 
•Relationship to adjacent sites and the overall street frontage
•How the proposal relates to unusual aspects of the site, like views or slopes
•Pedestrian and vehicular access to the site
•Quality of materials, open space, and landscaping
